poem:
**Contradictions in New Mexico**

Flames grasp the thirsty earth, 
a brutal dance—
then, the sky releases its fury,  
torrents pummel blackened hopes.  
Fire and flood embrace  
in a chaotic waltz,  
ash and water mingling  
in the labyrinth of loss,  
nature's tumultuous heart  
beats on.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Multiple disasters all in one day’: New Mexico’s brutal week of fire and flood It’s been a harrowing week of fire and flood in New Mexico. As the dueling dangers of two weather extremes converged, charred debris flowed into neighborhoods, crews". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
